item.title: Rising Tides: Kelley Misata on Bringing Cybersecurity to Nonprofits
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Leggio
item.description:
Sightline Security’s founder explains why nonprofits need cybersecurity solutions tailored to their unique missions — and why vendors need to listen.

The post Rising Tides: Kelley Misata on Bringing Cybersecurity to Nonprofits appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: SAP Zero-Day Targeted Since January, Many Sectors Impacted
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Hundreds of SAP NetWeaver instances hacked via a zero-day that allows remote code execution, not only arbitrary file uploads, as initially believed.

The post SAP Zero-Day Targeted Since January, Many Sectors Impacted  appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Company and Personal Data Compromised in Recent Insight Partners Hack
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
VC firm Insight Partners is informing partners and employees that their information was exposed in the January 2025 cyberattack.

The post Company and Personal Data Compromised in Recent Insight Partners Hack  appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Valuable Information Leaked in LockBit Ransomware Hack
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Private messages, Bitcoin addresses, victim data, and attacker information were leaked after someone hacked a LockBit admin panel.

The post Valuable Information Leaked in LockBit Ransomware Hack  appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Valarian Bags $20M Seed Capital for ‘Isolation-First’ Infrastructure Tech
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
British startup exits stealth with $20 million in seed-stage financing led by US investors Scout Ventures and Artis Ventures.

The post Valarian Bags $20M Seed Capital for ‘Isolation-First’ Infrastructure Tech appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Europol Announces More DDoS Service Takedowns, Arrests
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Four people have been arrested in Poland and several websites associated with DDoS-for-hire services have been shut down.

The post Europol Announces More DDoS Service Takedowns, Arrests appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Possible Zero-Day Patched in SonicWall SMA Appliances
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
SonicWall patches three SMA 100 vulnerabilities, including a potential zero-day, that could be chained to execute arbitrary code remotely.

The post Possible Zero-Day Patched in SonicWall SMA Appliances appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Russia-Linked APT Star Blizzard Uses ClickFix to Deploy New LostKeys Malware, Google Warns
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Russia-linked APT Star Blizzard is using the ClickFix technique in recent attacks distributing the LostKeys malware.

The post Russia-Linked APT Star Blizzard Uses ClickFix to Deploy New LostKeys Malware, Google Warns appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Improperly Patched Samsung MagicINFO Vulnerability Exploited by Botnet
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The patches for an exploited Samsung MagicINFO vulnerability are ineffective and a Mirai botnet has started targeting it.

The post Improperly Patched Samsung MagicINFO Vulnerability Exploited by Botnet appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cisco Patches 35 Vulnerabilities Across Several Products
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Cisco releases patches for 26 vulnerabilities in IOS and IOS XE software, including 17 critical- and high-severity bugs.

The post Cisco Patches 35 Vulnerabilities Across Several Products appeared first on SecurityWeek.
